isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - REASSEMBLE - ASSEMBLE THE MAIN DIFFERENTIAL AND RING GEAR ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: ASSEMBLE THE MAIN DIFFERENTIAL AND RING GEAR ASSEMBLY

caution.para: Do not press a cold ring gear on the flange case half. A cold ring gear will damage the case half because of the tight fit. Metal particles between the parts will cause gear runout that exceeds the specification of .008 inch (0.2 mm).

step1.para: Expand the ring gear by heating the gear in a tank of water to a temperature of 160°F to 180°F (71°C to 82°C) for 10 to 15 minutes.

warning.para: Wear safe clothing and gloves that will protect you from injury when you touch the hot ring gear.

step1.para: Safely lift the ring gear from the tank of water using a lifting tool.
Install the ring gear on the flange case half immediately after the gear is heated. If the ring gear does not fit easily on the case half, heat the gear again. Repeat Step 1.
Align fastener holes of the ring gear and flange case half. Rotate the ring gear as needed.

Install the bolts *, nuts* and washers* that hold the ring gear to the flange case half. Install the bolts from the gear side of the assembly. The bolt heads MUST be against the ring gear ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Install Bolts, Nuts and Washers Holding Ring Gear to Flange Case Half

step1.para: Tighten the bolts * and nuts * to the correct torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
If rivets * are used to hold the ring gear to the flange case half, install the rivets * as follows:

caution.para: Do not heat rivets before installation. Use only cold rivets to fasten the ring gear correctly on the flange case half.

step2.para: Install the correct size rivets * in pairs opposite each other from the case half side of the assembly. The rivet * heads MUST be against the flange case half ( Figure 87).
Press the rivets * into position from the ring gear side of the assembly. Use a riveter machine and apply the correct amount of pressure. See Chart below for rivet pressures.

table.title: Diameter of Rivet Body/Press Pressure Needed to Install Rivets

caution.para: The pressure on rivets must be held for approximately one minute so that the rivet body will fill the hole.

step2.para: After the rivets are installed, check for gaps between the back surface of the ring gear and the case flange. Use a .003 inch (.08 mm) feeler gauge and check at four points around the assembly ( Figure 88).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Check For Gaps Between Back Surface of Ring Gear and Case Flange

step2.para:
If the gauge fits more than one half the distance between the outer diameter of the flange and the pilot diameter of the gear, remove the ring gear. Refer to DISASSEMBLE THE DIFFERENTIAL AND RING GEAR ASSEMBLY
and the following Steps D and E. If the gap is less than .003 inch (.08 mm), continue by following Step 8.
Check the flange case half and ring gear for the problem that causes the gap. Repair or replace parts.
After the parts are repaired or replaced, assemble the ring gear on the flange case half.

step1.para: Install the bearing cones on both of the case halves. Use a press and sleeve of the correct size ( Figure 89).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Install Bearing Cones on Case Halves

step1.para: Apply axle lubricant on the inside surfaces of both case halves, spider (cross), thrust washers, side gears and differential pinions. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION.
Put the flange case half on a bench, ring gear teeth toward top.
Install one thrust washer and side gear into the flange case half ( Figure 90).

figure.caption: Figure 90. Install Thrust Washer and Side Gear into Flange Case Half

caution.para: The side gears in some carrier models have hubs of different lengths. Install the correct length side gear into the flange case half.

step1.para: Install the spider (cross), differential pinions and thrust washers into the flange case half ( Figure 91).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Install Spider, Differential Pinions and Thrust Washers into Flange Case Half

step1.para: Install the second side gear and thrust washer over spider and differential pinions ( Figure 92).

figure.caption: Figure 92. Install Side Gear and Thrust Washer Over Spider And Differential Pinions

step1.para: Put the plain half of the differential case over the flange half and gears. Rotate the plain half as needed to align the match marks ( Figure 92 and Figure 93).

figure.caption: Figure 93. Put Plain Half of Differential Case Over Flange Half and Gears

step1.para: Install Dri-Loc fasteners into the case halves. Refer to INSTALL NEW DRI-LOC FASTENERS.

step2.para: Install four capscrews * and washers * or bolts *, nuts * and washers * into the case halves. The distance between the fasteners MUST be equal. Tighten the fasteners to the correct torque value in a pattern opposite each other ( Figure 94). Refer to the TORQUE CHART for the correct torque value.

figure.caption: Figure 94. Tighten Fasteners in Pattern Opposite Each Other

step2.para: Install the other fasteners into the case halves. Tighten the fasteners to the correct torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
